title: 115_hr1563
content: The Act titled "Mary Jo Lawyer Spano Mesothelioma Patient Registry Act of 2017" establishes a patient registry for mesothelioma data collection and research under Title III of the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will develop a patient registry to collect data on mesothelioma in the United States, including tracking epidemiology, treatment outcomes, and prevalence of the disease. The Secretary will establish a patient registry to gather data on mesothelioma in the United States, including incidence, prevalence, demographic factors, and environmental/occupational associations. The information will be made available to the public to support research, prevention, and treatment efforts. The patient registry will gather data on mesothelioma in the United States, including demographics, risk factors, diagnosis markers, and relevant analysis information. The Secretary will consult with experts on mesothelioma epidemiology, natural history, prevention, detection, management, treatment, and outcomes measures. This includes epidemiologists and representatives of national associations with experience in mesothelioma research and patient care. The Secretary will consult with experts on mesothelioma epidemiology, prevention, detection, treatment, and outcomes measures. This includes health information technology experts, clinicians, and research scientists with experience in translational research. The Secretary will also coordinate with other federal agencies to share information from the registry. Public access to the information will be subject to certain conditions. The Secretary will make information from the mesothelioma patient registry available to the public, including researchers, while ensuring stringent privacy protections. A report outlining findings in the registry must be submitted to Congress within 18 months of the enactment of the Mary Jo Lawyer Spano Mesothelioma Patient Registry Act of 2017. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress within 4 years of the enactment of the Mary Jo Lawyer Spano Mesothelioma Patient Registry Act of 2017, detailing the development and maintenance of the mesothelioma patient registry, including future expansion plans and partnerships with research and patient advocacy communities. The Mary Jo Lawyer Spano Mesothelioma Patient Registry Act of 2017 requires the collection and storage of information on mesothelioma patients, guidelines for use, and coordination with other databases.
